oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1939-12-30 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from December 30, 1939. Featuring David Stone (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Uncle Dave Macon and son Dorris Macon, Ford Rush, the Gully Jumpers, and Robert Lunn. Held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Ford Rush; Uncle Dave Macon; Dorris Macon; Gully Jumpers
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Opening statement (David Stone) -- Opening theme -- David Stone introduces George D. Hay -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys -- Old Joe Clark (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- George D. Hay introduces Ford Rush -- Swing The Ladies Up And Down (Ford Rush, Smoky Mountain Boys) -- Prince Albert commercial (David Stone) -- George D. Hay introduces Uncle Dave Macon and Dorris Macon -- Hand Me Down My Walking Cane (Uncle Dave Macon, Dorris Macon) -- George D. Hay introduces the Gully Jumpers -- Ragtime Annie (Gully Jumpers) -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys -- Little Pal (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- George D. Hay introduces Uncle Dave Macon -- New Dude In Town (Uncle Dave Macon) [continued in part 2]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Stone, David P., 1901-1995; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Rush, Ford, 1895-; Macon, Uncle Dave, 1870-1952; Macon, Dorris; Gully Jumpers (Paul Warmack); Lunn, Robert
